article.headline: Ball State 76, Akron 72
article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. (AP) -- Robert Owens scored 20 points and grabbed nine rebounds to lead Ball State to a 76-72 victory over Akron on Monday in the first round of the Mid-American Conference tournament. Dennis Trammell added 18 for Ball State (14-14) in a game that saw 11 lead changes before the Cardinals opened a lead late in the game. Akron tied the game on a 3-pointer by Derrick Tarver with 5:16 remaining before Ball State went on a 7-0 run -- including 3-pointers by Terrance Chapman and Matt McCollom -- to take a 71-64 lead. Akron (13-15) closed to within three on a 3-pointer by Dru Joyce with 9 seconds left, but McCollom hit a free throw for the Cardinals to reach the final margin. Tarver led Akron with 25 points, while Joyce added 15 and Rick McFadden 14 for the Zips. Chapman scored 15 for the Cardinals, who play third-seeded Miami (Ohio) in the quarterfinals Thursday in Cleveland. The RedHawks had a first-round bye.
